item.title: Lucia add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "Finally he spoke the three simple words that no amount of bad art or bad faith can every quite cheapen. She repeated them, with exactly the same slight emphasis on the second word, as though she were the one to say them first. He had no religious belief, but it was impossible not to think of an invisible presence or witness in the room, and that these words spoken aloud were like signatures on an unseen contract." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description:
"You ask everybody you know: How long does it usually take to get over it?
There are many formulas. One year for every year you dated. Two years for every year you dated. It's just a matter of will power: The day you decide it's over, it's over. You never get over it." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "You're the only person I've ever met who can stand a bookstore as long as I can." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description: "Ana Iris once asked me if I loved him and I told her about the lights in my old home in the capital, how they flickered and you never knew if they would go out or not. You put down your things and you waited and couldn't do anything really until the lights decided. This, I told her, is how I feel." -- Junot Diaz

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description:
"Then you look at her and smile a smile your dissembling face will remember until the day you die. Baby, you say, baby, this is part of my novel.
This is how you lose her." -- Junot Diaz

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "And because love, real love, is not so easily shed." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "The truth is there ain’t no relationship in the world that doesn’t hit turbulence." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "It's just a matter of willpower. The day you decide it's over, it's over. You never get over it." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You don't get to choose if you get hurt in this world...but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "There are infinite numbers between 0 and 1. There's .1 and .12 and .112 and an infinite collection of others. Of course, there is a bigger infinite set of numbers between 0 and 2, or between 0 and a million. Some infinities are bigger than other infinities. A writer we used to like taught us that. There are days, many of them, when I resent the size of my unbounded set. I want more numbers than I'm likely to get, and God, I want more numbers for Augustus Waters than he got. But, Gus, my love, I cannot tell you how thankful I am for our little infinity. I wouldn't trade it for the world. You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Some infinities are bigger than other infinities." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Oh, I wouldn't mind, Hazel Grace. It would be a privilege to have my heart broken by you." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does." -- John Green

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Anthony Burgess
item.description: "Is it better for a man to have chosen evil than to have good imposed upon him?" -- Anthony Burgess

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Anthony Burgess
item.description: "When a man cannot chose, he ceases to be a man." -- Anthony Burgess

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "Basically what we have here is a dreamer. Somebody out of touch with reality. When she jumped, she probably thought she'd fly" -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "In the end, it wasn't death that surprised her but the stubbornness of life." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "We knew, finally, that the girls were really women in disguise, that they understood love and even death, and that our job was merely to create the noise that seemed to fascinate them." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Lucia add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "We could never understand why the girls cared so much about being mature, or why they felt compelled to compliment each other, but sometimes, after one of us had read a long portion of the diary out loud, we had to fight back the urge to hug one another or tell each other how pretty we were. We felt the imprisonment of being a girl, the way it made your mind active and dreamy, and how you ended up knowing which colors went together. We knew that the girls were our twins, that we allexisted in space like animals with identical skins, and that they knew everything about us though we couldn'y fathom them at all. We knew finally that the girls were really woman in diquise, that they understood love even death, and that our job was merely to create the noise that seemed to fascinate them." -- Jeffrey Eugenides
